Definitely do not order anything but breakfast. I say just ok. Price wise you'll keep most of your money....

Yelp, you failed me on this one. I'm going to break this down  easy. 

Chicken strips-over cooked, dry, and mostly breading

Garlic parmesan fries- fries tossed in burnt garlic oil hidden under a mound of fake, processed parmesan powder

Corned beef hash- flavorless,  mushy yet at the same time burnt pieces of potatoes. 

Eggs (ordered over medium) -too runny   

Pancakes with bacon- was delicious

Ritchi's Diner is a new restaurant that took over Babbo's old spot and although it's nice to have another non-chain restaurant in the area, there are much better options available.  I ordered an open faced turkey club sandwich, and I have a few complaints.  First the bread on the sandwich wasn't toasted, and it just made the bread soak up too much gravy leaving a very soggy bread with the turkey.  The vegetables clearly came from some frozen bag mix bought at Fry's or Walmart.  This leads to very disgusting tasting non-fresh vegetables that tastes more like a freezer than it does veges.  Also, because it's not fresh veges, it gets overcooked to defrost the greens and leads to even more sogginess.  Finally the mashed potatoes tasted like something from a box and lacked butter.  The poor sides is not acceptable in this day and age to be a successful restaurant.  On a positive note, the turkey and gravy were delicious.  It's a start, but for now, Richi's needs to step it up quickly.

Just enjoyed a great breakfast! If you are hungry and want great food this is your place. As our waitress said, "if you leave hungry, it's your own fault". Great food and great value. Nice service and atmosphere. We will definitely be back!!!

This was a waste of my time.  The hostess was grumpy the but little girl at check in was sweet and helpful. But the table service was very good Theresa was fast and spot on!
The eggs were all Cooked correctly. The sausage like we're large and undercooked as well as full of soy, yuck.  The patato cakes tasted worse than bricks, frozen something. 
The plus was you get lots for your money and the prices were fair.

I tried Nicks Dinner 2 and was extremely disappointed. I enjoy Nicks as I tried to support local mom and pop eateries, however the service was aweful. I ordered take out and the person sounds like I was an inconvenience to them. Once I got there I understood why. As it was slow. While I stood there waiting for someone to even acknowledge me 6 employees walked past me. When I was helped I could not be helped as the individual who placed my order was somewhere else. Hence, I had to wait for that person to ring me up. Overall, it lacks to family experience of the originals Nicks. Nicks 2 is in a huge hall that when empty is alot of space for the servers to cover. Maybe you will have a better expeience than I.

Stopped by Nick's (transitioning to Richi's) tonight for dinner. Hostess seated me quickly. I was dining alone tonight. Victoria was my server and she was attentive and pleasant. Decided on Baked Meatloaf with veggies, coleslaw and mashed potatoes.  The veggies were a soggy lukewarm serving and not much flavor. There was ample meatloaf smothered in brown gravy. It was ok but a little salty. All in all not the best meal I've had at Nick's. I'll be sticking to breakfast.

New location and actually a new name.  Ritchie's Diner.   Love the chicken lemon rice soup. I could eat it everyday along with the flaming cheese.   They do a great job at making the food....... if only they had the service to back it up.   They are slow to even acknowledge us after we are seated and. It even during a busy time.   Fix the service and they will be 5 stars.

Nick's has potential.My husband and I took and chance and tried out Nick's a couple of weeks ago. 

The menu is diverse including a lot of mediterranean/greek choices but more traditional "diner" fare as well. I tried the Greek Burger which is a regular burger smothered in feta- not shabby. I will admit I was jealous of another diner's omelet and wished I would of gone for the "breakfast for dinner" route instead. 

We are already talking about going back to try breakfast soon and I hope more people in the area check it out and support it so it doesn't meet the same fate as so many local places in Surprise do.

Note:  I'm writing this review about their Gyro.  If you don't plan to get a Gyro than take this with a grain of salt.

I'm very conflicted about this review because their Hummus is really good but the Gyro was a mess.  First of all they use Kronos like most all other places, so the meat was pretty standard.  Where they lost me was the Tzatziki.  What a joke.  You might aswell put straight yogurt on the gyro.  It lacked any spices or even a hint of cucumber.  Then to make matters worse they dumped their bland Tzatziki on top of the meat.

Call it a preference but a gyro should go pita, Tzatziki , onions, meat.   Then they served bland, undercooked, generic fries.

Too boot while I ate my lunch I got to hear, what I assume is the managers or owners, discussing with a couple why they don't think that the customers credit card information was stolen at their restaurant.  

I don't know what happened but I didn't want to hear that.  All in a bad visit not likely soon to repeat.

Good, simply down home cooking. Simple, inviting dining room with nice dining available outside. I had spaghetti and meatballs. Very good, sauce is sweet and hearty although I missed not having garlic bread which would of been a great addition. We also had lasagna which was excellent but again missed the garlic bread. Portions are large allowing for lunch the following day and a fantastic value over all. I did take notice of extremely good breakfast deals and will absolutely return to try. Great experience. Once again, satisfaction with the little guy versus chain restaurants.

Finally tried Richi's Diner today, and trust me all the good reviews are true, the only thing I could wish for would be a little more seasoning on the food. I understand they are located at the gates of a retirement community and you need to cater to your base customer. The service was great from the person who seated us to the person taking our orders and refilling our drinks. The place was clean and well decorated, a lot nicer than I expected of a place calling itself a Diner. Had the Steak and Eggs, (steak was cooked to order and was seasoned well) which came with potatoes that were cooked just right, just wished they would have been seasoned (more) when cooked. Nothing the salt and pepper on the table couldn't fix up quick. I think we even seen Richi himself making the rounds and making sure guests were happy. He was a gracious host and making conversation with all the guests, joking with us while making sure we were happy and had everything we needed. I think this place we end up on the come back and try more list.

You can't do much better for breakfast in Surprise than Nick's. Every time I go in I have to hold back from ordering something I clearly won't be able to finish......and where to start?!?! I'd do a poor job embellishing on what others have written - all I'll say, is that you like a cooked breakfast, eat here! nom nom nom.... :)
LOVE THIS PLACE! Great service and fantastic food with decent prices!!!

I have eaten here on many occasions and have never had a bad meal. Breakfast is huge and very tasty but, lunch is my favorite meal, the burgers are huge and hand made not those store bought patties, the Gyros are cooked to perfection, hint, get some extra taziki sauce to dip your fries in....yummy!!!!

The sign and menus say "Richi's Diner." It's in the old Babbo's space with indoor and patio dining. Friendly service, good food, offered coffee to go when we were done. What more could one want? My husband ordered the corned beef hash. It was fresh made, not the canned junk he usually gets at home. Ha! I had the Belgian waffle with sausage. The sausage was the big links that Nick's used to have. Probably the same people, but way better and friendlier service than Nick's had way back when they first opened. We tried the original Nick's several times years ago and finally quit going due to grouchy, poor service. If this is the same people, they finally got it right. Great location at Bell and Reems. It was a hit for us. I hope they keep it up!

Been a couple times and just not too impressed. Food is ok, but service is lacking. It's never a place that I think of when I want to eat breakfast. The location is a bit off the street and behind a credit union. It's a smaller restaurant, but is clean and food typically comes out somewhat quick. I usually try to go a few times before I leave a review to see how things are because everyone can have off days. There's just nothing about this place that stands out for me. Don't think we will come again.

Always enjoy coming here. Food is Always good, fresh, and home made. Love the new location and the staff is the same as it was especially the breakfast crew. 
If you have not already tried it, be sure you do. Richie & his staff doesn't disappoint.
Service was outstanding Kendall was super!!!!!!! Food was great! A must try. Menu with lots to choose from.
This has. Come my favorite place to grab food from.  Their burgers are insanely good.  I owned a business next door but went out of business myself, still stop by to eat here though!!

So Nicks is a great "greasy spoon" type of place. Poor, uninspired atmosphere, a few older sassy waitresses in with the younger first time servers. 
As you would expect, you have a menu with a few pictures of food; all of which don't look very appetizing.
The value is really the shining star of the place, though. Good food, really good quality, sizable portions and all at a more than reasonable price.
I visit here 2 - 3 times a month, enough to be recognized as a regular, and I will continue to support this place.
We've been here several times.  The weekday breakfast special is the best deal in town.  I have also been for lunch and highly recommend gyros.

BEST breakfast on West side.. pancakes, french toast, hash browns, coffee... Everything is delicious and fresh!!  Had lunch here the other day, Gyros are awesome! Highly recommend. Plus, I prefer to support local business owners over corporate owned places. Owner on site and very friendly. Servers are great, fast service.
Food is always very good but the wait staff is always standing around talking etc. hard to get their attention if you need anything such as a drink refill etc. too bad since the food is good

This is not the Nick's Diner Two, on Waddell. While the menu is almost identical and the portions are generous, the service left a lot to be desired.  My buddies and I tried all the Nick's breakfast specials, the omelette, the scramble, the chicken fried steak and while portions were large, flavor was not.  I chose the scramble with gyro meat and found very little meat or taste.  Service was prompt but our server was a bit "uninformed".  A decent breakfast, but not necessarily a place that I would go back too.

Food was 2 out of 5. I felt some of there ingredients or sauces were canned or came from a jar.

Atmosphere was really bad. Felt like I was in a small school cafeteria or something.

Will not be going back.

Great place for breakfast near our 2nd home in Sun City West! Good portions and depending on which waitstaff you get, pretty good service! Has a variety of menu items; Greek, Italian, And really good hamburgers with fries or/and onion rings.

Food was good! service sucked. From the second I walked in I felt like I was bothering them coming into the place. Then my waitress got my order wrong and argued with me over it.  It's really a shame that the service is so bad that you cannot even enjoy the food I had to wait to get a drink many times where the place is empty and the workers are just talking.

I'm upset we took so long to check this place out! The diner is very well decorated and feels clean and modern. Our server Heather was awesome, food came out quickly, and most of all, our breakfast tasted fresh and seemed to be made from some really good quality foods. Everything from the eggs to the toast just seemed to be better than most "diner" and breakfast spots we have visited around Phoenix. 

We will be back!
I've only ordered 1 thing on the menu, the Greek omelette!  It's incredible, very big, contains gyro meat and feta cheese and veggies.  A must try.

I have eaten hear a dozen or so times.  I enjoy the food.  Some times the service is a bit inconsistent, but never had a noticeable problem.  For the prices, the quality is hard to match.  Defiantly worth a try for anyone in the area.

I just had a great Philly Cheese steak.  The hostess is such a nice lady. She made me feel really good with her sweat personality. My waitress Heather did a great job. This place was packed and she still gave my table a lot of attention. The food also came real fast. This is a new favorite place. Good food! Good price! Good service!

So disappointing...I have been dying for an authentic NJ style Diner...it's not a lot to ask...low prices, great food...

* Not one item came out the way we requested
* Spaghetti sauce was sweet- it's not supposed to be
* Items were left off our plates b/c they assumed we didn't want them (asked for no ham on club, so they assumed we didn't want bacon either)
* Added on a soup, they took away our fries- assumed we wanted to subsitute
* Pasta was overcooked and oily : My kid threw up afterwards
* Son had a beef kabob- meat was tougher than nails

This place has gotten progressively worse. The "home fries" are either burnt hard or chewy raw. The new menus look great but are held together with bread ties. I believe in supporting our local restaurants but this is our last time here.
Very very nice, friendly staff and delicious food. The owner gave me a complimentary glass of wine while I waited for my to-go order.

My fries have always been perfect as well as their food. My only suggestion would be to wash off the condiment bottles.  I always use a napkin to hold the ketchup bottle.  
I still eat here often

We love to go every Friday because we get endless cod fish. The owner of restaurant is very professional, nice and friendly. I recommend everyone to go at this location. Food is great also. Viorel, Surprise, Az.

I just  walked out of Ritchie's. Waited 10 minutes after waitress took my drink order, (tea) despite there being a whole pitcher of tea sitting nearby & being shared with other wait staff. It wasn't even busy. They're usually very good, but tonite I protested with my wallet & ate across the street.

I have been here three times. We had a regular breakfast place back in tx and thought this might become our regular breakfast place here in AZ. Everything went fine the first couple times we ate here, good food, good specials, clean restaurant, and friendly staff. But on our last visit, after the meal I asked my waitress why my $5.59 breakfast special came out to over $8. The waitress bluntly told me it's because you had onions on your potatoes, I asked if they normally charge $2.50 for onions? And she told me yes in a very offended tone. After that short exchange her whole demeanor changed, she ignored us the rest of the time we were there and took over 30 minutes after we finished our meal to take my card to pay the bill, finally I had to just take the bill up to the counter myself and pay. I am the last person to give a business a less than favorable review because of one bitter employee, but I kid you not, when we went up to the counter every employee we saw and passed looked at us like we just shot the president. The lady at the counter never looked at me and when she finally did take my card she snatched it out of my hand and threw it back on the counter at me after she charged it, she threw the card back... My mouth dropped, I have never experienced that before, and over something as petty as me asking about the price of onions? I know you probably think I'm the douche who nit picks everything and makes every waitresses life a living hell, but I am the complete opposite. I tip very well and am nothing but friendly and courteous, but I am also going to be the first to call you out if you provide shitty service. I still left her a 20% tip.

Everything was OK.  We were seated promptly but the hostess forgot to bring menus. Decent food but nothing special, service was pretty good but everyone seemed sort of distracted talking with the owners at their family table.  The prices were reasonable.

A friend had warned us that this was not the best place to go, but I will probably give it another chance.

I can say I like Nick's for breakfast. Decent food, decent prices and they usually are spot on.They have some good choices and portions are right on. Even the small order of French toast really can be split by two people, it is alot of toast-just order an extra side of meat and you got a cheap b-fast

This past weekend I took myself to breakfst and things did not go as well as normal. I received my #2 with bacon, but alas no toast. The waitress said she would bring it in a moment. My super hot food was hard to resist so I hate a piece of bacon a couple bites of potatoes and after 5 minutes, still no toast. 

When the toast finally got there after what seemed like 10 minutes, my food was only warm then and the appeal had left me. It is hard to eat over easy eggs without toast ya know?

I have gone there for other meals too, fish and chips are good, gyro meat is good and club sandwich is good. I always order my home fries and reg, fries 'crispy' as they seem to cook them but not to my liking of crispy.I like the type of fries they have, closer to steak fries but a bit slimmer in cut. 

I did have a friend who will not go here anymore because he ordered the Friday Night all-you-can -eat special (the week before it actually started as they posted it but did not say it was starting the next week) and got a piece of fish that was still cold inside. He thought no biggie, I'll just get more fish and send this back. Well they didn't honor all you can eat AND they refused to remake the part that was cold on the inside. Just bad customer service all around on this one.  

So, I would say very good place for breakfast and lunch, dinners are good but not great and will fill the need when you want a simple, decent meal at a decent price. 
Btw, on many visits I have seen the Sheriff deputies here and the SFD getting takeout for breakfast so you know these guys like to eat good stuff.

Nice spot. Better location than the old one. The name was changed from Nick's to Richi's. Our waitress didn't know what was in the club sandwich. She waited for another employee to come over and advise. She was very friendly though and the menu is very large so if she's new I understand. I ended up ordering the club sandwich  since it comes with ham, turkey and bacon. I ordered it with fries. Place was pretty busy. I like that because the food must be good, right? Food was affordable.

Stopped by for breakfast & was greeted, seated and had a cup of coffee right away. Asked for 2 eggs, 2 bacon & a biscuit. She said we had to select one of the menu choices. Weird! So, finally just had bacon & eggs. Had to wait quite awhile to be served & no one ever asked how everything was & we had to wave someone down for the one and only coffee refill. Won't go back.
Server attitudes have greatly improved. New servers are awesome.  Food is amazing.  Transition to Richi is cool he's very out front with the customers.   Among our favorites now!

Second visit. I had the Denver Sandwich and it was yummy. It's a mini Denver omelet sandwiched in sourdough. The oatmeal was really good too. Served with milk, raisins, and brown sugar just added the raisins and brown sugar and it was good to go. Looking forward to another visit...soon!

That is a VERY generous 2 star. Came in starving left angry and still starving. 

Ordered the fettuccini Alfredo w chicken and some lemon soup cuz I hate cold slaw.

Waited an hour for my food

The soup tasted like ass 

The dish came with no chicken 

The fettuccini was bland

Asked for chicken and waited another 35 min 

I didn't eat my dish, I didn't leave a tip, and I stole a fork. I'm not going back.

Pretty disappointing.  It was OK for a breakfast I suppose, but when there are so many better options in the area, we won't be back.  The French toast had no flavor, just bread and egg.  The home fries were the same, just potatoes, no salt, pepper, or anything.  The bacon was obviously premise in bulk and left out to wait for orders, very dried out.  Just bland and plain all around.
Consistently good food for a good price. The owner is a really nice guy, also, and often comes out to talk to the customers. Their new location is nice, too. Highly recommended.

This is a nice little diner. We were looking for a place for breakfast for my son's birthday. We live in the East Valley but we're up in Surprise visiting family for the holidays. I was kind of leery because the reviews were all over the place but decided to give it a try. The waitress was very nice and accommodating. She refilled my coffee multiple times, brought my son a cup of water because she noticed his juice was done, and brought my mom a second tea bag and pot of water. The waitress even brought crayons and coloring book pages for my 3 kids to keep them occupied while wait for our meal. At the end, she gave each kid 2 quarters so they can put it in the toy machine and get a prize. That was a hit for the kids. Food wise, I ordered the Belgium waffle and it was good. My daughter got the eggs and hash browns. The hash browns were cold, but it was also really cold outside, so not sure if it was because that was the last thing she decided to eat off her plate or if they truly weren't cook to a hot temperature. Portions were big and reasonably priced. My husband said the bacon was too salty, but my kids loved it and my mom said it was good. We will definitely try this place again.
It's just ok. Nothing special or great about it. Pancakes are dry and most of the food is bland

My son and I were craving some chicken strips and Gyro meat to take home. We hadn't been to the original Nick's in a while. I've gotten used to restaurants not listening to what you say when you order carry out. They got our order exactly like I said and it was prompt and they treated us with as much respect as dine in customers. You'd think you can't mess up chicken strips and gyro meat right? Well I wouldn't be writing this except the gyro meat was perfect beautiful , I'd be happy with some scraps but it wasn't and the chicken strips were perfectly cooked not over or under. The quoted time was exactly what they said even though they were busy. A simple order but very well done.
Went to Nick's for lunch. Had a hamburger. My wife had a pita sandwich. Both were served with salad  rather than fries (our choice). Both were very tasty. Will go again.
My daughter comes here with her dad and grandma. She said it was great. So we checked it out. And it was amazing. Our server was great heather.

Horrible! Came in for breakfast about 9am. Not busy, about 5 or 6 people. Ordered bacon, eggs, potatoes and toast. All came out cold. I sent it all back and a minute later, it comes back out. not much better and still not hot. I then get to the last couple of pieces of bacon and not only where they still cold, but more raw then cooked. VERY DISAPPOINTED. That will be the last visit.

I don't know what Donna R.'s problem is, but her review is 100% unfair and vindictive. I eat at Nick's # 1 every day for three reasons: 1. The food is excellent, 2. The prices can't be beat, and 3. Because Theresa works there! Far from being "rude" or "burned out", she has a loyal following of customers...all of whom she treats with respect and a great sense of humor. Regulars or newcomers..they are all welcomed...and the size of your tip has nothing to do with it.
